segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me feel so sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just drying dishes, completely unaware of the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and the boy is about to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like this scene is a metaphor for how people ignore problems until it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and soon it’s going to ruin everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so focused on her task that she doesn’t see the danger around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is wobbling dangerously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a deep sense of sadness watching this unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting for her cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me feel so heavy.
segments.speaker: PAR
